li.a: New Bremen Junior High & High School (7-12)

img.alt: COVID-19 Image and Link to information on New Bremen School and coronavirus

li.a: New Bremen Junior High & High School (7-12)

img.style: border-width:0px;width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12);

img.alt: football team huddled together in red uniforms
students smiling and raising hands in hallway

td.span: A member of the MAC Athletic League in west-central Ohio, New Bremen offers student-athletes a wide range of sports for a school our size and in one of the best small-school conferences in Ohio

Students at New Bremen Schools consistently perform at an Excellent level. With outstanding teachers, programs and technology, our students not only succeed on standardized tests, but are also substantially prepared for college or the work force.

The New Bremen community is a great place to live, not to mention a fantastic place to go to school. Located at the summit of the Miami-Erie Canal and with many dining and entertainment options, our small town is a wonderful place to call home.

div.span: Remote learning for the remainder of this school year

br.span: Today, Governor DeWine extended remote learning through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Therefore, remote learning will continue through Monday, May 11th. If you have any questions, please feel free to submit them using our COVID-19 page located by clicking here.

div.span: Remote Learning Extended Until At Least May 1, 2020

br.span: Governor Mike DeWine extended K-12 school closures until at least May 1st. New Bremen Schools will continue to provide remote learning during this period of time. Teachers are currently in the process of planning lessons for students that may include online, paper-pencil, or a combination depending on the student’s accessibility to technology. Additional information will be communicated soon regarding dates, times, and methods for students and parents to safely pick up additional paper-pencil lessons. If you have any questions, please feel free to submit a question using the coronavirus page located here.

div.span: Ohio's Stay At Home Order

span.div: The Ohio Department of Health issued a Stay at Home Order for non-essential travel on Sunday. The Order does allow for educational travel to maintain remote education operations and meals for eligible students. The District plans to continue providing remote education and meal services unless directed otherwise by State or local agencies.

div.br: Therefore, the drop box and material exchange set-up at the high school and elementary will continue to be open. We will be cleaning the drop-off areas multiple times per day and encourage you to use the hand sanitizer we have provided at each location. If you are not comfortable with dropping materials off you may scan or take a picture of the materials and email them directly to the teacher.
If you have any questions regarding District operations, please feel free to email us using the question box on the District coronavirus operations webpage.

div.style: float:left; width:100%; margin-top:30px; border-left:1px solid #CFCFCF; padding:0 25px;

NOTICE TO PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES
Persons with disabilities may request access to, or notify the District about, online information or functionality which is currently inaccessible by contacting:
Brian Puthoff, Director of Technology
New Bremen Local School District, 901 East Monroe Street, New Bremen, OH 45869
PH: (419) 629-8606
EM: brian.puthoff@newbremenschools.org
